bottomLine: This armband tracker works with other apps like MyFitnessPal, tracks sleep, and has a food log feature. But it didn't earn recommended status since most panelists didn’t like how it felt on their arms. It also doesn’t give instant feedback and it has to be synced with a smart phone or computer to get results.

summary: This activity tracker, BodyMedia Fit Link Armband, counts steps, tracks calories, logs calorie intake from foods you consume, monitors sleep efficiency, and syncs to your computer or smart phone.

bottomLine: This tracker has lights that show your progress toward daily goal. It also tracks calories, logs foods you eat, tracks sleep, and connects to apps like Lose It! and MapMyFitness.  You can swim and shower with it (but it won’t track swimming as an activity). You must sync with a computer or smart phone since there are no results shown on it. And the USB dongle enabling wireless hookup is tiny—could be lost.

summary: This activity tracker, the Fitbit Flex, counts steps, tracks calories, logs calorie intake from foods you consume, monitors sleep efficiency, syncs wirelessly to your computer or smart phone, and it has an indicator to tell you how close you are to your daily activity goal. You also can swim or shower with this tracker and it has an alarm.

bottomLine: This recommended activity monitor tracks calorie intake and connects to apps including RunKeeper and MyFitnessPal. It also tracks sleep, provides health tips, and can be worn in the shower. But it's not for you if you like instant gratification since it doesn't provide instant feedback or sync wirelessly; it must be plugged into a smart phone or an Apple tablet.

summary: Ths activity tracker, Up by Jawbone, tracks calories, counts steps, logs calorie intake from foods you consume, and monitors sleep efficiency. It also can be worn in the shower.

bottomLine: This tracker's screen has a frog that “leaps” as you near 10,000 steps. It also tracks sleep and calorie intake (with use of compatible Apple products), and it  can connect to apps like RunKeeper. You can clip it on your waistband or wear it on your wrist. But panelists said it looks bulky on the wrist. And we found it was less accurate on the wrist than when clipped on. It also was the hardest to read in sunlight.

summary: This activity-monitoring device, iHealth Wireless Activity and SleepTracker, counts steps, tracks calories, logs calorie intake from foods you consume, provides real time results throughout the day, monitors sleep efficiency, syncs wirelessly to your computer or smart phone, and it has an indicator to tell you how close you are to your daily activity goal. It also has a built-in clock and an alarm.

bottomLine: This top-performing tracker shows your progress as a flower that “grows.” And it encourages you with messages like, “Faster, Ed!” It also tracks calorie intake and syncs with apps like MyFitnessPal and SparkPeople. It also tracks how long you slept and how often you woke during night. You have options how you wear it since it can clip on your waistband, bra, or pocket. But it's hard to read in sunlight. And the USB dongle enabling wireless hookup is tiny and could be lost.

summary: This activity tracker, the Fitbit One, counts steps, tracks calories, logs calorie intake from foods you consume, provides real time results throughout the day, monitors sleep efficiency, syncs wirelessly to your computer or smart phone, and it has an indicator to tell you how close you are to your daily activity goal. bottomLine: This recommended tracker displays progress as a “fuel number” and it has lights that turn green when you reach a daily goal. It was the easiest of those tested to read in sunlight. You also can wear it in the shower. But unlike the other devices, it can't log food. And it doesn't track sleep.

ratings.description: Construction considers aspects that impact quality like the motor and related components, running deck and the results of our durability tests.
Ease of use considers the ease of using the controls, functions, programs and reading the display.

Ergonomics considers how well the machine accommodates users of different sizes and includes belt size, foot-rail design and handgrip design.
Exercise range considers the aspects that provide an effective workout to users of various fitness levels, from beginners to very fit individuals.

Overall score is based mainly on ergonomics, construction, ease of use and exercise range. Scores and tests have been ammended slightly so previously posted results may differ from the current results. The displayed score is based on a total of 100 points.

User safety considers operational safety and security, including stop-button size and location, safety-key operation, the possibility of striking the motor housing, and the security of the deck when folded

ratings.description: How easy the various buckles and adjustments of the helmet are to use. Based on sensory panelist judgments.
How versatile the helmet retention system adjustments are with regard to the ability to accommodate various head sizes and shapes.  Based on expert judgements.

How well a helmet can absorb impact forces, thus reducing the deceleration experienced by a head, during an impact.  Based on helmet performance in laboratory impact tests at various impact speeds and impact surfaces under several conditions.
Judged primarily on the basis of impact absorption, retention system strength,ventilation, ease of use, resistance to roll-off and also weight and features.
Our evaluation of how well air flows through the helmet to provide cooling while riding.
All other things being equal, a helmet that weighs less causes less fatigue. Score is based on weight relative to other tested helmets.

ratings.description: Considers the operational sound and the feel of the bike, product defects, and other quality indicators.
Assesses display clarity, ease of console operation, function and adjustment of the resistance level
Assesses pedal design, configuration and adjustability of the seat and handlebars, and potential interference of riding positions and motion from the bike itself.
Evaluates the bike's ability to provide various workout intensity for users of different fitness levels.
This score is based on ergonomics, exercise range, ease of use, construction and user safety. The displayed score is out of a total of 100 points.
Assesses potential hazards, such as pinch points, brake operation, and stability.

ratings.description: Construction considers aspects that indicate good construction methods, design choices and our perception of quality based on noise, feel and ride.
Ease of use considers ease of use aspects of controls, display and using the programs.
Ergonomics considers how well an elliptical accommodates people of various sizes and aspects of the pedaling motion.
Exercise range considers aspects of exercise intensity and measures incline and the effort to pedal the machine through the resistance level settings.
Heart-rate features considers features like heart-rate sensor type and heart-rate programs but does not evaluate their performance.
Overall Score is based on ergonomics, exercise range, ease of use, construction, heart-rate monitoring and user safety.
User safety considers aspects of safety including pinch points, non-slip materials, stability and static loading strength.

specs.description: Indicates whether or not a chest-strap heart-rate monitor is included as a standard feature.
Indicates how many settings exist to adjust the incline.
Magazine rack indicates whether the elliptical has a shelf for reading material which can be read while exercising.
Indicates whether the moving arms have handgrips that allow for multiple handgrip positions.
Operational footprint Indicates the minimum area required for a machine to operate, not including space needed for mounting or dismounting the machine.
Indicates how many settings exist to adjust the resistance.
Indicates the type of electrical power used to run the elliptical.
Indicates how many settings exist to adjust the stride length.
Indicates the gross weight of the machine including packaging.

summary: This model has been tested by our experts.

description: NOTE: The touch-screen monitor is highly sensitive and often scrolled rapidly through selections. We found erratic monitor behavior if the batteries were not well charged. Also, we found that the pedaling resistance of the elliptical often did not change after we increased the resistance level setting. And the heart-rate display did not accurately track heart rate and would often jump from a higher reading to a lower reading.

The prominent characteristic(s) of the wine that define its "personality" e.g. fruity, woody, yeasty, vegetal, etc.
Varietal refers to a specific type of grape within the genus/species Vitis vinifera. In this case one grape is known by different names in different parts of the world (e.g. Syrah or Shiraz).

specs.description: The odor of fresh blackberries, sometimes showing as the odor of a blackberry jam or syrup.
Cassis is a liqueur made from black currant juice. Black currants have an odor that is a combination of generic black berry plus an herbal/menthol odor. The wine taster smells both simultaneously.
The smell of ground black pepper if it were to be dissolved in wine.
The smell of fresh, ripe black plums or a jam made from same.
A “soft” caramelized-type smell of baker’s brown sugar, sometimes with a molasses note.
An aroma reminiscent of fresh red and/or black cherries.
The faint smell of ground cinnamon.
Refers to a generalized flower-like note.
Refers to smell of green plant material, such as herbs when no single herb smell is identifiable.
The smell of new leather, as though you just walked into a shoe store or a leather jacket shop.
The spicy-fennel-like smell of black licorice candy
Having aromas and flavors suggestive of raspberries.
The smell of moist, fresh tobacco as you would find in a purchased pouch of tobacco. Sometimes the smell can be more similar to an aromatic pipe tobacco, or a cigar humidor.
The smell of vanilla extract
Refers to odor and flavor that suggest green vegetables (e.g. green peppers, green beans, green olives, fresh celery, gooseberry and asparagus).

summary: This model has been evaluated by our experts.

bottomLine:
Rich, full fruit flavors with a good acid-tannin structure and nice bitter notes that enhance. Trace alcohol.

Pot Roast and roasted potatoes, BBQ ribs or chicken, burgers or steak with grilled portabello mushrooms.

bottomLine:
A well made wine with a food friendly tart finish, but a simpler style. Shorter finish and less intense wood flavors than most.

Pasta with marinara sauce, sauteed peppers with eggplant, mushrooms, fresh cracked pepper and thyme.

The taste resulting from grape sugars in the wine or sugars added. A dry wine has no perceptible taste of sweetness. Off dry wines possess a slight amount of perceptible sugar, right at the threshold.
Varietal refers to a specific type of grape within the genus/species Vitis vinifera. In this case one grape is known by different names in different parts of the world (e.g. Syrah or Shiraz).

specs.description: The smell of a freshly cut apple.
Aroma and flavor of ripe apricots.
The generalized smell of citrus fruit .
A subtle odor resembling that of candle wax or smell of a newly opened box of crayons. Found more often in white wines than reds.
Refers to a generalized flower-like note.
A smell or flavor reminiscent of honey.
Aroma and flavor of ripe white peaches.
Riesling wines, especially mature examples. sometimes give a bouquet impression of petrol that is considered to be a positive attribute when present in low concentrations.

A general term used to describe a range of fruits in which an outer fleshy part surrounds a shell (the pit or stone) with a seed inside. Examples include peaches, plums, cherries, mangoes and apricots.
A generalized smell of co-mingled banana, pineapple, guava, passion fruit.

summary: This model has been evaluated by our experts.

bottomLine:
Lighter, simpler style with tart acidity and hints of under ripe white peach. Shorter finish than most.

price.description: Approximate retail price of a pack of coffee pods.

ratings.description: Cost per pod.
Overall score is based on blind taste tests by coffee experts.
Number of pods per pack.
Shape of the pod.  Coffee machines which use pods can only fit a specific type.  Some types have been on the market longer or are more popular.  Therefore, there are more coffee selections available.

specs.description: A sweet aromatic reminiscent of heated sugar and often associated with the caramelized sugars of a higher-quality dark roast coffee.

The degree to which the coffee beans have been roasted as reflected in the aromatics.  A light or underroasted product is described as having a "raw green bean" character.  A very dark roasted product is described as a "charred," "burnt,"or "espresso-type product."
A dull aromatic reminiscent of wood.
A heavy undertone aromatic reminiscent of clean, moist garden soil.
A basic taste associated with bitter compounds such as caffeine.
Desirable, somewhat fleeting aromatic associated with the aroma of ripe, mixed fruits (not citrus).  This flavor is slightly heavier than the floral aromatics.
A clean, light, fleeting acid aromatic associated with high-quality Arabica beans.
Sweet aromatic reminiscent of freshly roasted peanuts or tree nuts.
An aromatic reminiscent of wet cardboard.

summary: Generally not as complex and/or more intense negatives, but if you drink your coffee with cream and sugar (or chocolate, caramel, whipped cream, etc.), defects may not be as noticeable.

bottomLine: Overall, weak with fleeting coffee aromatics. Drinkable and forgettable.

ratings.description: Accuracy was measured against a highly accurate electrocardiograph; the higher the accuracy score, the more often the monitor displayed the same heart rate as the reference did.
Ease of use includes features, clarity of instructions, and convenience as judged by panelists who used the devices.
Overall score is based on accuracy and ease of use.
Sports versatility indicates whether a model is difficult or easy to use for all or most sports.

Indicates whether the model employs a chest strap mounted sensor that transmitts to a watch, a chest strap mounted sensor that transmits to an iPhone app, a watch that requires the user to touch the rim or button to take an intermittent reading or a watch that takes continuous heart rates from the user's wrist.

specs.description: Display is backlit so it can be seen in the dark.
Displays the number of calories burned.
Model has pedometer function.
Upper and lower values can be set by user.
Model has a stopwatch function.

specs.displayName: Difficult to use for some exercises
specs.description: Indicates whether a model is difficult to use while engaged in some exercises.
